entry.title: paleoflora of the Eocene Okanagan Highlands (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the paleoflora of the Eocene Okanagan Highlands (fossil pictured) has a notable mixture of both temperate and subtropical plants?

entry.title: Janowar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Raihan Rafi, the writer and director of the 2021 Bangladeshi film Janowar, interviewed the alleged perpetrators of the quadruple murder on which it is based?

entry.title: Jason Moore (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jason Moore and other Wikipedia editors curated the entry about the January 6 United States Capitol attack in real time?

entry.title: Englische Ansage (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in Loriot's comedy sketch "Englische Ansage", a German TV announcer played by Evelyn Hamann despairs of pronouncing complicated English names?

entry.title: Cedric Oglesby (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that former Arizona Cardinals kicker Cedric Oglesby, one of the first African-American kickers in NFL history, received his chance to play when the team's previous kicker injured himself celebrating?

entry.title: Chōgaku-ji (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chōgaku-ji's bell-tower gate was originally built in the early 9th century and is the oldest of its kind in Japan?

entry.title: Nathan Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Nathan Smith made 110 consecutive appearances for Port Vale after his 2016 English Football League debut?

entry.title: an affinity for gambling (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Roman emperors Augustus and Claudius may have had an affinity for gambling?
